frameDefinitions: A Self_mover leaves an initial Source location.
An entity is integrated into a building as a Part of a (possibly unexpressed)
A Person is in a state of prosperity and/or renown after some period of development or hardship in an Endeavor.
A Supporter assists to strengthen the Supported by lending itself in material aid (or abstract assistance in the case of metaphorical uses).
A Destroyer (a conscious entity) or Cause (an event, or an entity involved in such an event) affects the Patient negatively so that the Patient no longer exists.
This frame describes a Theme losing its autonomy and perhaps sustaining material damage as the result of a successful invasion on the behalf of a Conqueror.
frameExamples: We need new <t>counters</t> for the kitchen
The bottom of the wall is <t>supported</t> by the foundation.
The Spaniards <t>conquered</t> the Incas with both the Cross and the arquebus
listRoleDefinitions: This is the entity which moves under its own power.

Any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Source</fen>. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. In particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.
The time at which the motion takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the motion (which is specified by a <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen>) is located.
A  <fen>Part</fen> of a larger architectural unit, the  <fen>Whole</fen>.
An architectural unit which includes the <fen>Part</fen>.
A sentient being or group of beings that is prosperous or well known after being involved in some <fen>Endeavor</fen>.
An event that the <fen>Person</fen> is involved in which leads to their state of prosperity or renown.
The time when the <fen>Entity</fen> is determined to be successful.
The <fen>Supporter</fen> acts to benefit the <fex name='Supported'>Supported</fex> by providing additional strength or stability.
The <fen>Supported</fen> is given strength through the assistance of the <fen>Supporter</fen>.
This role identifies when the support occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the support occurs.
The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs the intentional action that results in the <fen>Patient</fen>'s destruction.
The entity which is destroyed by the <fen>Destroyer</fen>.
The event or entity which is responsible for the destruction of the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Destroyer</fen> destroys the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Destroyer</fen> destroys the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The <fen>Conqueror</fen> is the entity that overtakes the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the land, government, and its people that is seized by the <fen>Conqueror</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Conqueror</fen> seizes the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Conqueror</fen> takes over the <fen>Theme</fen>.
listRoleExamples: The <fex>living-room</fex> fireplace  is just for show.
<fex>He</fex> became a success at the age of 25.
Looking back, I had a very successful <fex>career</fex>.
After 20 years of hard work, he finally made it as an artist <fex>in '84</fex>.
<fex>Early in the twentieth century</fex>, such economic arguments buttressed the creation of a National Park Service.
<fex>In England</fex>, economic incentives are buttressed by closing certain overdoctored areas from new practices.
<fex>The subsequent explosions</fex> leveled most downtown office buildings.
<fex>The Achaemenid monarch Cambyses</fex> conquered Egypt in the year 525 BC
Britain had an opportunity to conquer <fex>Europe</fex>.
China 's <fex>1997</fex> takeover would push over 10 per cent of the population out of the colony
<fex>On Planet Earth</fex>, humans prefer to conquer those lands whose acquistion offers some economic benefit or advantage.
